newsitem.title: UK: Storehouse sees bigger increase in final div.
newsitem.headline: Storehouse sees bigger increase in final div.

text.p: Storehouse Plc said on Thursday it planned to increase its final dividend by more than the 10 percent rise in its interim payout.
The group said trading in the first five weeks of its second half had been encouraging.
Storehouse said it planned to weight dividend payments more heavily towards the second half to reflect the fact that this is when it makes most of its profit.
"It is our policy to rebalance dividend payments gradually in order to reflect the second-half profit emphasis of the group," it said in a statement. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
